sentence.Network_en: We had to scrimp and save to pay the bills.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们得省吃俭用来付帐.

sentence.Network_en: They had to scrimp and save to send their son to college.
sentence.Network_cn: 为了送儿子上大学,他们不得不省吃俭用,拼命攒钱.

sentence.Network_en: She had to scrimp and save to pay for her holiday.
sentence.Network_cn: 她必须节省开支以支付度假的费用.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 18th cent. (in the sense 'keep short of food'): from Scots scrimp 'meagre'; perhaps related to shrimp

entry.tran: 节省;精打细算;省吃俭用
entry.def: If you scrimp on things, you live cheaply and spend as little money as possible.

example.ex: Scrimping on safety measures can be a false economy...
example.tran: 在安全措施上抠手抠脚可能会打错算盘。

example.ex: He has had to give up luxuries as he scrimps and saves while looking for a job.
example.tran: 找工作期间，他只好放弃奢侈的生活，精打细算、省吃俭用。

auth_sentence.content: The scheme was ideal, says Greenaway, left, "as it meant I didn't have to scrimp and save to kit out my apartment".

sentences.en: They scrimped on butter as best as they could.
